title: The Great Charter
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,513 words, Level Y (Grade 5), Lexile 960L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     Z1 and Z2
description: Would you stand for a tyrant king who took your money and land as he pleased? Travel to medieval England and read about barons who organized for freedom. Read more about the Great Charter, a document that upholds the principle that no one is above the law. Vivid illustrations, timelines, and maps support the text as students learn about author's purpose and past-tense verbs. The book and lesson are also available for levels Z1 and Z2.
highFrequencyWords: barons, charter, civil war, Crusade, humbled, interdict, nullified, oath, rebellion, successor, taxed, tried
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Past-Tense Verbs                : Identify and use past-tense verbs
awareness: Suffixes : Define and use the suffix -ed
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
